result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $350 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 03-24-2017 or serve 3 days in the House of Correction.  Court orders defendant to pay $50.00 forthwith.  Court orderd the defendant to provide DNA sample.
With credit for 4 days.  TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Grant

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment Notice returned by USPS as undeliverable

F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
3 days HOC.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Allen Grant in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  
Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Plea hearing Held:
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing hearing proceeded.  
Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4days  in the House of Correction, with credit for 4 days, TIME SERVED.
Fine of $350 including all  mandatory costs, fees and surchrges to be paid by March 24, 2017 or serve 3 days in the House of Corrections.
Court Orders Defendant to pay $50.00 FORTHWITH.

The Court ordered the Defendant to provide DNA SAMPLE.

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Allen Grant in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Ahmad is new counsel.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Allen Grant in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No file in court.  Violation report received and filed. Court admonished defendant but did not change the bail. Case remains on for status.

Defendant Allen Grant in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant has consulted with attorneys.  Court allows for more time for defendant to accumulate funds.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen Grant in court.  Katie Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant received a list of low costs attorneys.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Allen Grant in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Allen Grant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION if released from custody.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
